Korea grand sale 2015 
When: Till October 31, 2015 
Where: Korea 
The 6th Korea Grand Sale opened on 14th August 2015 to make the foreign tourists' visit to South Korea a memorable and joyful experience. The Grand Sale will continue for 79 days until October 31st 2015. This shopping-tourism festival is unlike the other shopping festivals in the world, which focus only on shopping. It aims to provide the foreign visitors a quality time in Korea in all aspects such as shopping, entertainment and tourism. The benefits include discounts on shopping, tourist attractions, accommodations, transportation, food, beverages and entertainment. The visitors can benefit from 70 per cent discounts for limited seats on all Jeju Air routes. Major stores like Lotte Duty Free Shops (Largest department stores of Korea offering luxury products) are offering up to 80% discount and 50% discounts on day passes are being offered on Everland day pass (Everland is the largest amusement park of Korea). 
Phases of the moon, art, music festival 
When: September 17-20, 2015 
Where: Arkansas, USA 
Phases of the Moon presents 100% organic, feel-good music f, as the tagline goes. That boils down to jam rock, bluegrass, funk and soul, all performed by musicians with instruments (no DJs and electronic tunes allowed). But the bands are just one ephase f of four that the festival incorporates: inspiring artwork, a sense of community and a conscious collective are the others. So it's a hippietrippy crowd that makes its way to Mulberry Mountain. Grizzled Deadheads, tie-dye-clad college students and dreadlocked parents with toddlers come from around the country to kick off their sandals and sway to the jam. Soon everyone becomes part of the Phaser family. 
The festival grounds stretch over a 3000-acre prairie park that provides room to run into all kinds of oddities: art installations of giant flowers to climb, a random drum circle, people dancing amid mega bubbles, fire twirlers and much more. Or head off on your own and hang out in a field with your banjo. 
Mahuli nature trek 
When: September 5-6, 2015 
Where: Mahuli 
Tucked away in the foothills of the Mahuli range, on the border of Thane and Palghar districts, the location of this nature camp is ideal to enjoy the lush green forest in monsoon. This camp organised by BNHS aims at giving an exquisite camping experience in the rains. With naturalist experts to guide, one will enjoy their encounters with butterflies, birds, frogs and wild flowers. To add to the experience, the participants will be trained on how best to capture nature's beauty on camera. They will be briefed about the essentials in trekking and adventure activities too. 
Bestival 
When: September 10-13, 2015 
Where: Isle of Wight 
Bestival is an award winning 4 day boutique music festival set at Robin Hill . a beautiful leafy country park (a veritable Garden of Eden) near Downend and Newport in the heart of the Isle of Wight. The wonderful world of Bestival was born out of ten fun years of pioneering music events and record releases from Rob da Bank fs Sunday Best empire. The renowned music specialist had a dream to one day create his vision of how the modern day festival should be. Along with Creative Director and wife Josie da Bank and co founders /partners John and Ziggy from Get Involved that dream is now fulfiled. On a mission to change the face of independent festival culture, the fearless foursome are bringing some magic to the shores of the Solent and spreading the love worldwide. It's Rob and Josie da Bank's creative vision that sets Bestival apart. Whilst the massive musical brain of Rob ensures the Bestival line-up is the most eclectic you'll ever experience, it's Josie's creative wand that casts its magic over Bestival land. From the most original boutique campsite experience, to the Bollywood Cocktail Bar, a Wishing Tree Stage, fancy dress en-masse and even a landlocked Port, it's this uniqueness that makes Bestival a wondrous world of discovery and adventure that will inspire peace, love and dancing not only in September but all year round...
